trans-unit.source: When unpacking a corrupt packfile, the command dies at the first corruption. This flag tells it to keep going and make the best effort to recover as many objects as possible.
trans-unit.target: 当解压一个损坏的打包文件时,命令在第一次损坏时就会死亡。这个标志告诉它继续前进,尽最大努力恢复尽可能多的对象。

trans-unit.source: When unspecified, all references, after filtering done with --heads and --tags, are shown. When <refs>…​ are specified, only references matching the given patterns are displayed.
trans-unit.target: 未指定时，将显示使用--heads和--tags过滤后的所有引用。当指定<refs> ...时，仅显示与给定模式匹配的参考。

trans-unit.source: When used in conjunction with the untracked cache, it can further improve performance by avoiding the cost of scanning the entire working directory looking for new files.
trans-unit.target: 当与未跟踪的缓存一起使用时,它可以避免扫描整个工作目录寻找新文件的成本,从而进一步提高性能。

trans-unit.source: When used together with -B, omit also the preimage in the deletion part of a delete/create pair.
trans-unit.target: 与 -B 一起使用时，还删除删除/创建对的删除部分中的原映像。

trans-unit.source: When used with -C/-c/--amend options, or when committing after a conflicting cherry-pick, declare that the authorship of the resulting commit now belongs to the committer. This also renews the author timestamp.
trans-unit.target: 当与-C/-c/--amend选项一起使用时,或者在冲突的cherry-pick之后提交时,声明提交结果的作者身份现在属于提交者。这也会更新作者的时间戳。

trans-unit.source: When used with -M, a totally-rewritten file is also considered as the source of a rename (usually -M only considers a file that disappeared as the source of a rename), and the number n controls this aspect of the -B option (defaults to 50%). -B20% specifies that a change with addition and deletion compared to 20% or more of the file’s size are eligible for being picked up as a possible source of a rename to another file.
trans-unit.target: 与-M一起使用时，完全重写的文件也被视为重命名的源（通常-M仅将消失的文件视为重命名的源），数字 n 控制-B选项的这一方面。 （默认为50％）。 -B20% 指定与文件大小的20％或更多相比，带有添加和删除的更改有资格作为重命名为另一个文件的可能来源。

trans-unit.source: When used with --all print description for all recognized commands. This is the default.
trans-unit.target: 与 --all 打印说明一起使用时，可识别所有命令。这是默认值。

trans-unit.source: When used with -ad, any unreachable objects from existing packs will be appended to the end of the packfile instead of being removed. In addition, any unreachable loose objects will be packed (and their loose counterparts removed).
trans-unit.target: 与 -ad 一起使用时，现有包中所有无法访问的对象都将附加到packfile的末尾，而不是被删除。此外，所有不可触及的松散物品都将被打包（并清除其松散的对应物品）。

trans-unit.source: When using --error-unmatch to expand the user supplied <file> (i.e. path pattern) arguments to paths, pretend that paths which were removed in the index since the named <tree-ish> are still present. Using this option with -s or -u options does not make any sense.
trans-unit.target: 当使用--error-unmatch将用户提供的<file>（即路径模式）参数扩展到路径时，请假装由于指定的<tree-ish>而在索引中删除的路径仍然存在。将此选项与 -s 或 -u 选项一起使用没有任何意义。

trans-unit.source: When using --hash (and not --dereference) the output format is: <SHA-1 ID>
trans-unit.target: 使用--hash（而不是--dereference）时，输出格式为： <SHA-1 ID>

trans-unit.source: When using --full-history, Git walks every edge. This will discover the commits A and B and the merge M, but also will reveal the merge commits O and P. With parent rewriting, the resulting graph is:
When using --get, and the requested variable is not found, behave as if <value> were the value assigned to the that variable.
trans-unit.target: 使用 --get 时，未找到请求的变量，其行为就像<value>是分配给该变量的值一样。

trans-unit.source: When using git diff to compare with work tree files, do not consider stat-only change as changed. Instead, silently run git update-index --refresh to update the cached stat information for paths whose contents in the work tree match the contents in the index. This option defaults to true. Note that this affects only git diff Porcelain, and not lower level diff commands such as git diff-files.
trans-unit.target: 使用 git diff 与工作树文件进行比较时，请勿将仅统计更改视为已更改。取而代之的是，静默运行 git update-index --refresh 来更新其工作树中的内容与索引中的内容匹配的路径的缓存统计信息。此选项默认为true。请注意，这仅影响 git diff 瓷器，而不影响较低级别的 diff 命令，例如 git diff-files 。

trans-unit.source: When using either the ssh:// or file:// transport, the GIT_PROTOCOL environment variable must be set explicitly to include "version=2".
trans-unit.target: 当使用ssh://或file://传输时,GIT_PROTOCOL环境变量必须明确设置为包含 "version=2"。

In these cases, use init to set up your Git repository then, before your first fetch, edit the $GIT_DIR/config file so that the branches and tags are associated with different name spaces. trans-unit.target: 当使用 git://传输时,你可以通过发送 "version=2 "作为额外参数来请求使用协议 v2。

trans-unit.source: When using the http:// or https:// transport a client makes a "smart" info/refs request as described in http-protocol.txt and requests that v2 be used by supplying "version=2" in the Git-Protocol header.

trans-unit.source: When we discuss merges we’ll also see the special name MERGE_HEAD, which refers to the other branch that we’re merging in to the current branch.
trans-unit.target: 在讨论合并时，我们还会看到特殊名称MERGE_HEAD，它表示我们要合并到当前分支的另一个分支。

trans-unit.source: When we need to be precise, we will use the word "branch" to mean a line of development, and "branch head" (or just "head") to mean a reference to the most recent commit on a branch. In the example above, the branch head named "A" is a pointer to one particular commit, but we refer to the line of three commits leading up to that point as all being part of "branch A".
trans-unit.target: 当我们需要精确的时候,我们会用 "分支 "来表示一条开发线,用 "分支头"(或者直接用 "头")来表示对一个分支上最近一次提交的引用。在上面的例子中,名为 "A "的分支头是一个指向某个特定提交的指针,但我们将通往该点的三条提交线都称为 "分支A "的一部分。

trans-unit.source: When writing a script that is expected to handle random user-input, it is a good practice to make it explicit which arguments are which by placing disambiguating -- at appropriate places.
trans-unit.target: 在编写预计处理随机用户输入的脚本，这是一个很好的做法，使之明确其论据是它通过将多义性 -- 在适当的地方。

trans-unit.source: When writing remote-helpers for decentralized version control systems, it is advised to keep a local copy of the repository to interact with, and to let the private namespace refs point to this local repository, while the refs/remotes namespace is used to track the remote repository.
trans-unit.target: 在为分散式版本控制系统编写远程帮助程序时,建议保留一个本地版本库的副本与之交互,并让私有命名空间refs指向这个本地版本库,而refs/remotes命名空间则用于跟踪远程版本库。

trans-unit.source: When writing, the new value is written to the repository local configuration file by default, and options --system, --global, --worktree, --file <filename> can be used to tell the command to write to that location (you can say --local but that is the default).
trans-unit.target: 写入时，默认情况下，新值将写入存储库本地配置文件，并且选项 --system ，-- --global ，-- --worktree 和 --file <filename> 可用于告诉命令写入该位置（您可以说 --local ,但这是默认设置）。

trans-unit.source: When you are happy with the state of this change, you can merge it into the "test" branch in preparation to make it public:
trans-unit.target: 当你对这个变化的状态感到满意时,你可以将它合并到 "测试 "分支中,准备将它公开。

trans-unit.source: When you are in the middle of something, you learn that there are upstream changes that are possibly relevant to what you are doing. When your local changes do not conflict with the changes in the upstream, a simple git pull will let you move forward.
trans-unit.target: 当您处于某种中间状态时，您会了解到上游的变化可能与您所做的事情有关。当本地更改与上游更改不冲突时，简单的 git pull 将使您前进。

trans-unit.source: When you are in the middle of something, your boss comes in and demands that you fix something immediately. Traditionally, you would make a commit to a temporary branch to store your changes away, and return to your original branch to make the emergency fix, like this:
trans-unit.target: 当你正在做一件事的时候,你的老板来了,要求你立即修复某件事情。传统上,你会在一个临时的分支上做一个承诺,把你的修改储存起来,然后回到你原来的分支进行紧急修复,就像这样。

trans-unit.target: 当您在一个紧密的小型小组中工作时，一次又一次地与同一个存储库进行交互并不罕见。通过定义 remote 存储库速记，可以使其变得更容易：

trans-unit.source: When you ask git-diff[1] to show the conflicts, it runs a three-way diff between the conflicted merge results in the work tree with stages 2 and 3 to show only hunks whose contents come from both sides, mixed (in other words, when a hunk’s merge results come only from stage 2, that part is not conflicting and is not shown. Same for stage 3).
trans-unit.target: 当您要求git-diff [1]显示冲突时，它将在工作树的阶段2和3的冲突合并结果之间运行三向diff，以仅显示其内容来自双方的混合块（在其他换句话说，当大块的合并结果仅来自阶段2时​​，该部分不会冲突且不会显示（与阶段3相同）。

trans-unit.source: When you run git checkout <something> or git switch <something> and only have one remote, it may implicitly fall back on checking out and tracking e.g. origin/<something>. This stops working as soon as you have more than one remote with a <something> reference. This setting allows for setting the name of a preferred remote that should always win when it comes to disambiguation. The typical use-case is to set this to origin.
trans-unit.target: 当您运行 git checkout <something> 或 git switch <something> 并且只有一个远程控制器时，它可能隐式地退回到签出并跟踪，例如 origin/<something> 。只要有多个带有 <something> 引用的遥控器，这就会停止工作。此设置允许设置首选遥控器的名称，在消除歧义时应始终取胜。典型的用例是将此设置为 origin 。

trans-unit.source: When you start a 3-way merge with an index file that is already populated, it is assumed that it represents the state of the files in your work tree, and you can even have files with changes unrecorded in the index file. It is further assumed that this state is "derived" from the stage 2 tree. The 3-way merge refuses to run if it finds an entry in the original index file that does not match stage 2.
trans-unit.target: 当你用一个已经填充的索引文件开始3路合并时,假定它代表了工作树中文件的状态,你甚至可以有文件的变化没有记录在索引文件中。进一步假设这个状态是由第2阶段的树 "衍生 "出来的。如果在原始索引文件中发现一个与阶段2不匹配的条目,3-way合并将拒绝运行。

trans-unit.source: When you want to just integrate with the work leading to the commit that happens to be tagged, e.g. synchronizing with an upstream release point, you may not want to make an unnecessary merge commit.
trans-unit.target: 当你只想整合导致提交的工作,而这个工作恰好被标记,例如与上游发布点同步,你可能不想做一个不必要的合并提交。

trans-unit.source: When you’re ready, just run
trans-unit.target: 准备好后，就跑步

trans-unit.source: When your topic branch is long-lived, however, your topic branch would end up having many such "Merge from master" commits on it, which would unnecessarily clutter the development history. Readers of the Linux kernel mailing list may remember that Linus complained about such too frequent test merges when a subsystem maintainer asked to pull from a branch full of "useless merges".
trans-unit.target: 然而,当你的主题分支寿命很长时,你的主题分支最终会有很多这样的 "Merge from master "的提交,这将不必要地使开发历史混乱。Linux内核邮件列表的读者可能还记得,当一个子系统维护者要求从一个满是 "无用的合并 "的分支中拔出时,Linus抱怨过这种过于频繁的测试合并。

trans-unit.source: When your topic branch modifies an overlapping area that your master branch (or upstream) touched since your topic branch forked from it, you may want to test it with the latest master, even before your topic branch is ready to be pushed upstream:
trans-unit.target: 当你的主题分支修改了你的主分支(或上游)在你的主题分支分叉后所触及的重叠区域时,你可能需要用最新的主分支来测试它,甚至在你的主题分支准备推送到上游之前。

trans-unit.source: Whenever possible, section headings should clearly describe the task they explain how to do, in language that requires no more knowledge than necessary: for example, "importing patches into a project" rather than "the git am command"
trans-unit.target: 只要有可能，各节标题都应使用不需要多于必要知识的语言清楚地描述他们解释如何做的任务：例如，“将补丁导入项目”而不是“ git am 命令”

trans-unit.target: 其中“ oldsha1”是先前存储在<ref>中的40个字符的十六进制值，“ newsha1”是<newvalue>的40个字符的十六进制值，而“ committer”是提交者的名称，电子邮件地址和标准Git提交者标识格式的日期。 。

trans-unit.target: 其中,所有字段都如上所述,"message "是提供给-m选项的值。

trans-unit.target: 创建 Git 仓库的位置。如果没有提供,则使用p4仓库路径中的最后一个组件来创建一个新的目录。

trans-unit.source: Whether Git detects directory renames, affecting what happens at merge time to new files added to a directory on one side of history when that directory was renamed on the other side of history. If merge.directoryRenames is set to "false", directory rename detection is disabled, meaning that such new files will be left behind in the old directory. If set to "true", directory rename detection is enabled, meaning that such new files will be moved into the new directory. If set to "conflict", a conflict will be reported for such paths. If merge.renames is false, merge.directoryRenames is ignored and treated as false. Defaults to "conflict".
trans-unit.target: Git 是否会检测目录重名,影响合并时对历史上一方目录的新文件的检测,当该目录在历史的另一方被重名时,会发生什么情况。如果merge.directoryRenames设置为 "false",则目录重名检测将被关闭,这意味着这些新文件将被留在旧目录中。如果设置为 "true",则启用目录重命名检测,这意味着这些新文件将被移到新目录中。如果设置为 "冲突",则会报告此类路径的冲突。如果merge.renames为false,merge.directoryRenames将被忽略,并作为false处理。默认为 "冲突"。

trans-unit.source: Whether Git detects renames. If set to "false", rename detection is disabled. If set to "true", basic rename detection is enabled. Defaults to the value of diff.renames.
trans-unit.target: Git 是否会检测重名,如果设置为 "false",则禁用重名检测。如果设置为 "false",则禁用重命名检测。如果设置为 "true",则启用基本重名检测。默认为 diff.renames 的值。

trans-unit.source: Whether and how Git detects renames in git-status[1] and git-commit[1] . If set to "false", rename detection is disabled. If set to "true", basic rename detection is enabled. If set to "copies" or "copy", Git will detect copies, as well. Defaults to the value of diff.renames.
trans-unit.target: Git是否以及如何检测git-status [1]和git-commit [1]中的重命名。如果设置为“ false”，则禁用重命名检测。如果设置为“ true”，则启用基本的重命名检测。如果设置为“份数”或“副本”，Git也将检测到副本。默认为diff.renames的值。

trans-unit.source: Whether and how Git detects renames. If set to "false", rename detection is disabled. If set to "true", basic rename detection is enabled. If set to "copies" or "copy", Git will detect copies, as well. Defaults to true. Note that this affects only git diff Porcelain like git-diff[1] and git-log[1], and not lower level commands such as git-diff-files[1].
trans-unit.target: Git是否以及如何检测到重命名。如果设置为“ false”，则禁用重命名检测。如果设置为“ true”，则启用基本的重命名检测。如果设置为“份数”或“副本”，Git也将检测到副本。默认为true。请注意，这仅影响 git diff Porcelain，如git-diff [1]和git-log [1]，而不影响较低级别的命令，例如git-diff-files [1]。

trans-unit.source: Whether git should follow HTTP redirects. If set to true, git will transparently follow any redirect issued by a server it encounters. If set to false, git will treat all redirects as errors. If set to initial, git will follow redirects only for the initial request to a remote, but not for subsequent follow-up HTTP requests. Since git uses the redirected URL as the base for the follow-up requests, this is generally sufficient. The default is initial.
trans-unit.target: git是否应遵循HTTP重定向。如果设置为 true ，git将透明地遵循它遇到的服务器发出的任何重定向。如果设置为 false ，git会将所有重定向视为错误。如果设置为 initial ，则git只会将重定向用于初始请求到远程的重定向，而不用于后续的后续HTTP请求。由于git使用重定向的URL作为后续请求的基础，因此通常就足够了。默认值为 initial 。

trans-unit.source: Whether that update is allowed without --force depends on the ref namespace it’s being fetched to, the type of object being fetched, and whether the update is considered to be a fast-forward. Generally, the same rules apply for fetching as when pushing, see the <refspec>... section of git-push[1] for what those are. Exceptions to those rules particular to git fetch are noted below.
trans-unit.target: 不使用 --force 是否允许该更新取决于要获取的ref名称空间，要获取的对象的类型以及是否将该更新视为快速转发。通常，提取时适用相同的规则，有关内容请参见git-push [1]的 <refspec>... 部分。以下是 git fetch 特有的那些规则的例外情况。

trans-unit.source: Whether the CVS server interface is enabled for this repository. See git-cvsserver[1].
trans-unit.target: 是否为此存储库启用了CVS服务器接口。参见git-cvsserver [1]。

trans-unit.source: Whether to enable the grouping of projects by category on the project list page. The category of a project is determined by the $GIT_DIR/category file or the gitweb.category variable in each repository’s configuration. Disabled by default (set to 0).
trans-unit.target: 是否在项目列表页面上按类别启用项目分组。项目的类别由每个存储库配置中的 $GIT_DIR/category 文件或 gitweb.category 变量确定。默认情况下禁用（设置为0）。

trans-unit.source: Whether to print the diffstat between ORIG_HEAD and the merge result at the end of the merge. True by default.
trans-unit.target: 是否在合并结束时打印ORIG_HEAD和合并结果之间的差异统计。默认为true。

trans-unit.source: Whether to show a diffstat of what changed upstream since the last rebase. False by default.
trans-unit.target: 是否显示自上次 rebase 以来上游变化的 diffstat。默认为False。

trans-unit.source: Whether to skip reading settings from the system-wide $(prefix)/etc/gitconfig file. See git[1] for details.
trans-unit.target: 是否跳过系统范围的$（prefix）/ etc / gitconfig文件中的设置。有关详细信息，请参见git [1]。

trans-unit.source: Whether to skip reading settings from the system-wide $(prefix)/etc/gitconfig file. This environment variable can be used along with $HOME and $XDG_CONFIG_HOME to create a predictable environment for a picky script, or you can set it temporarily to avoid using a buggy /etc/gitconfig file while waiting for someone with sufficient permissions to fix it.
trans-unit.target: 是否跳过系统范围的 $(prefix)/etc/gitconfig 文件中的设置。此环境变量可以与 $HOME 和 $XDG_CONFIG_HOME 一起使用，以为挑剔的脚本创建可预测的环境，或者可以临时设置它，以避免在等待具有足够权限的人对其进行修复时使用有问题的 /etc/gitconfig 文件。

trans-unit.source: Whether to use ANSI escape sequences to add color to patches. If this is set to always, git-diff[1], git-log[1], and git-show[1] will use color for all patches. If it is set to true or auto, those commands will only use color when output is to the terminal. If unset, then the value of color.ui is used (auto by default).
trans-unit.target: 是否使用ANSI转义序列为色块添加颜色。如果将其设置为 always ，则git-diff [1]，git-log [1]和git-show [1]将对所有修补程序使用颜色。如果将其设置为 true 或 auto ，则这些命令仅在输出到终端时才使用颜色。如果未设置，则使用 color.ui 的值（默认情况下为 auto ）。

trans-unit.source: Whether to use empty blobs as rename source.
trans-unit.target: 是否使用空的 blobs 作为重命名源。

trans-unit.source: Whether to verify the SSL certificate when fetching or pushing over HTTPS. Defaults to true. Can be overridden by the GIT_SSL_NO_VERIFY environment variable.
trans-unit.target: 在获取或通过HTTPS推送时是否验证SSL证书。默认为true。可以被 GIT_SSL_NO_VERIFY 环境变量覆盖。

trans-unit.source: Which file to place a pattern in depends on how the pattern is meant to be used.
trans-unit.target: 将图案放在哪个文件中取决于图案的使用方式。

trans-unit.source: Which merge strategy to choose by default when resolving notes conflicts. Must be one of manual, ours, theirs, union, or cat_sort_uniq. Defaults to manual. See "NOTES MERGE STRATEGIES" section above for more information on each strategy.
trans-unit.target: 解决音符冲突时默认选择哪种合并策略。必须是 manual ， ours ， theirs ， union 或 cat_sort_uniq 之一。默认为 manual 。有关每种策略的更多信息，请参见上面的“合并提示策略”部分。

trans-unit.source: Which merge strategy to choose by default when resolving notes conflicts. Must be one of manual, ours, theirs, union, or cat_sort_uniq. Defaults to manual. See "NOTES MERGE STRATEGIES" section of git-notes[1] for more information on each strategy.
trans-unit.target: 解决音符冲突时默认选择哪种合并策略。必须是 manual ， ours ， theirs ， union 或 cat_sort_uniq 之一。默认为 manual 。有关每种策略的更多信息，请参见git-notes [1]的 “注释合并策略”部分。

trans-unit.source: Which merge strategy to choose when doing a notes merge into refs/notes/<name>. This overrides the more general "notes.mergeStrategy". See the "NOTES MERGE STRATEGIES" section above for more information on each available strategy.
trans-unit.target: 做注释时选择哪种合并策略合并为refs / notes / <name>。这将覆盖更通用的“ notes.mergeStrategy”。有关每种可用策略的更多信息，请参见上面的“注意合并策略”部分。

trans-unit.source: Which merge strategy to choose when doing a notes merge into refs/notes/<name>. This overrides the more general "notes.mergeStrategy". See the "NOTES MERGE STRATEGIES" section in git-notes[1] for more information on the available strategies.
trans-unit.target: 做注释时选择哪种合并策略合并为refs / notes / <name>。这将覆盖更通用的“ notes.mergeStrategy”。有关可用策略的更多信息，请参见git-notes [1]中的“ NOTES MERGE STRATEGIES”部分。

trans-unit.source: Which ref (or refs, if a glob or specified more than once), in addition to the default set by core.notesRef or GIT_NOTES_REF, to read notes from when showing commit messages with the git log family of commands. This setting can be overridden on the command line or by the GIT_NOTES_DISPLAY_REF environment variable. See git-log[1].
trans-unit.target: 除了使用 core.notesRef 或 GIT_NOTES_REF 设置的默认值之外，还可以使用哪个ref（如果一个glob或多次指定，则引用）从使用 git log 系列命令显示提交消息时读取注释。可以在命令行上或通过 GIT_NOTES_DISPLAY_REF 环境变量来覆盖此设置。参见git-log [1]。

trans-unit.source: Which ref to manipulate notes from, instead of refs/notes/commits. This overrides the core.notesRef setting.
trans-unit.target: 从哪个ref操纵注释，而不是 refs/notes/commits 。这将覆盖 core.notesRef 设置。

trans-unit.source: Which refs, in addition to the default set by core.notesRef or GIT_NOTES_REF, to read notes from when showing commit messages with the log family of commands. See git-notes[1].
trans-unit.target: 除了使用 core.notesRef 或 GIT_NOTES_REF 设置的默认值之外，当使用 log 系列命令显示提交消息时，该ref 还将读取注释。参见git-notes [1]。

trans-unit.source: Which will add the following to a file named .gitconfig in your home directory:
trans-unit.target: 这会将以下内容添加到主目录中名为 .gitconfig 的文件中：

trans-unit.source: Which would result in:
trans-unit.target: 这将导致:

trans-unit.source: While $GIT_DIR/info/sparse-checkout is usually used to specify what files are in, you can also specify what files are not in, using negate patterns. For example, to remove the file unwanted:
trans-unit.target: 虽然 $GIT_DIR/info/sparse-checkout 通常用于指定其中的文件，但是您也可以使用取反模式来指定 not 文件。例如，要删除 unwanted 的文件：

trans-unit.source: While $GIT_DIR/info/sparse-checkout is usually used to specify what files are included, you can also specify what files are not included, using negative patterns. For example, to remove the file unwanted:
trans-unit.target: 虽然 $GIT_DIR/info/sparse-checkout 通常用于指定要包括的文件，但是您也可以使用负模式来指定 not 包括的文件。例如，要删除 unwanted 的文件：

trans-unit.source: While <rev>^<n> was about specifying a single commit parent, these three notations also consider its parents. For example you can say HEAD^2^@, however you cannot say HEAD^@^2.
trans-unit.target: 尽管 <rev>^<n> 是关于指定单个提交父级的，但是这三个表示法也考虑了其父级。例如，您可以说 HEAD^2^@ ，但是不能说 HEAD^@^2 。

trans-unit.source: While git archimport will try to create sensible branch names for the archives that it imports, it is also possible to specify Git branch names manually. To do so, write a Git branch name after each <archive/branch> parameter, separated by a colon. This way, you can shorten the Arch branch names and convert Arch jargon to Git jargon, for example mapping a "PROJECT--devo--VERSION" branch to "master".

While git archimport will try to create sensible branch names for the archives that it imports, it is also possible to specify Git branch names manually. To do so, write a Git branch name after each <archive/branch> parameter, separated by a colon. This way, you can shorten the Arch branch names and convert Arch jargon to Git jargon, for example mapping a "PROJECT{litdd}devo{litdd}VERSION" branch to "master".
trans-unit.target: 虽然 git archimport 将尝试为其导入的档案创建明智的分支名称，但也可以手动指定Git分支名称。为此，请在每个<archive / branch>参数后写一个Git分支名称，并用冒号分隔。这样，您可以缩短Arch分支名称，并将Arch术语转换为Git术语，例如将“ PROJECT {litdd} devo {litdd} VERSION”分支映射到“ master”。

trans-unit.source: While git log -G"frotz\(nitfol" will show this commit, git log -S"frotz\(nitfol" --pickaxe-regex will not (because the number of occurrences of that string did not change).
While git log -G"regexec\(regexp" will show this commit, git log -S"regexec\(regexp" --pickaxe-regex will not (because the number of occurrences of that string did not change).
trans-unit.target: 虽然 git log -G"regexec\(regexp" 将显示此提交，而 git log -S"regexec\(regexp" --pickaxe-regex 则不会）（因为该字符串的出现次数未更改）。

trans-unit.source: While git svn can track copy history (including branches and tags) for repositories adopting a standard layout, it cannot yet represent merge history that happened inside git back upstream to SVN users. Therefore it is advised that users keep history as linear as possible inside Git to ease compatibility with SVN (see the CAVEATS section below).
trans-unit.target: 尽管 git svn 可以跟踪采用标准布局的存储库的复制历史记录（包括分支和标签），但它尚不能表示git内部返回到SVN用户的合并历史记录。因此，建议用户在Git内将历史记录保持尽可能线性，以简化与SVN的兼容性（请参阅下面的CAVEATS部分）。

trans-unit.source: While Git normally leaves file contents alone, it can be configured to normalize line endings to LF in the repository and, optionally, to convert them to CRLF when files are checked out.
trans-unit.target: 虽然Git通常不会去管文件内容,但它可以配置在版本库中把行结尾规范化为LF,还可以在文件被签出时将其转换为CRLF。

trans-unit.source: While a tree represents a particular directory state of a working directory, a commit represents that state in "time", and explains how to get there.
trans-unit.target: 树代表了一个工作目录的特定目录状态,而提交则代表了这个状态的 "时间",并解释了如何到达那里。

trans-unit.source: While an "easy case recovery" sometimes appears to be successful even in the hard case, it may have unintended consequences. For example, a commit that was removed via git rebase --interactive will be resurrected!
trans-unit.target: 尽管即使在困难的情况下，“简单的案例恢复”有时似乎也会成功，但它可能会带来意想不到的后果。例如，通过 git rebase --interactive 删除的提交将被复活！

trans-unit.source: While at it, check the info and final-commit files as well. If what is in final-commit is not exactly what you would want to see in the commit log message, it is very likely that the receiver would end up hand editing the log message when applying your patch. Things like "Hi, this is my first patch.\n" in the patch e-mail should come after the three-dash line that signals the end of the commit message.
trans-unit.target: 同时，还要检查 info 和 final-commit 文件。如果 final-commit 中的内容与提交日志消息中所显示的不完全相同，那么接收方很有可能最终会在应用补丁时最终手动编辑日志消息。修补程序电子邮件中的诸如“嗨，这是我的第一个修补程序。\ n”之类的内容应位于表示提交消息结束的三点划线之后。

trans-unit.source: While creating changes is useful, it’s even more useful if you can tell later what changed. The most useful command for this is another of the diff family, namely git diff-tree.
trans-unit.target: 虽然创建更改很有用，但是如果您以后可以告诉您更改内容，则将更加有用。对此最有用的命令是 diff 系列的另一个命令，即 git diff-tree 。

trans-unit.source: While it is possible to override all attributes, well behaving helpers should refrain from doing so for any attribute other than username and password.

While one could just alter the configuration settings in the gitweb CGI itself, those changes would be lost upon upgrade. Configuration settings might also be placed into a file in the same directory as the CGI script with the default name gitweb_config.perl — allowing one to have multiple gitweb instances with different configurations by the use of symlinks.
trans-unit.target: 尽管可以更改gitweb CGI本身中的配置设置，但这些更改在升级时将丢失。配置设置也可以放置在与CGI脚本相同目录中的文件中，默认名称为 gitweb_config.perl －通过使用符号链接，允许一个具有多个具有不同配置的gitweb实例。

trans-unit.source: While parent object ids are provided on the command line, author and committer information is taken from the following environment variables, if set:
trans-unit.target: 虽然父对象的id是在命令行中提供的,但作者和提交者的信息来自于以下环境变量(如果设置了)。

trans-unit.source: While you are in the middle of working on something complicated, you find an unrelated but obvious and trivial bug. You would like to fix it before continuing. You can use git-stash[1] to save the current state of your work, and after fixing the bug (or, optionally after doing so on a different branch and then coming back), unstash the work-in-progress changes.
trans-unit.target: 在您从事复杂工作的过程中，您会发现一个不相关但明显而琐碎的错误。您想先修复它，然后再继续。您可以使用git-stash [1]保存工作的当前状态，并在修复了错误之后（或者，可以选择在其他分支上执行此错误，然后再返回），然后取消存储进行中的更改。

trans-unit.source: Whitespace separated fields; any run of whitespace can be used as field separator (rules for Perl’s "split(" ", $line)").
trans-unit.target: 空格分隔的字段；任何空格都可以用作字段分隔符（Perl的“ split(" ", $line) “规则）。

trans-unit.source: Whitespace-separated list of allowed SMTP-AUTH mechanisms. This setting forces using only the listed mechanisms. Example:
trans-unit.target: 以空格分隔的允许的SMTP-AUTH机制列表。此设置只强制使用列出的机制。例如:

trans-unit.source: Why bisecting merge commits can be harder than bisecting linear history
trans-unit.target: 为什么二分合并提交比二分线性历史更难?

trans-unit.source: Wildcards in the pattern such as * or ? are treated as literal characters.
trans-unit.target: 模式中的通配符，例如 * 或 ? 被视为文字字符。

trans-unit.source: Will copy all files listed from the index to the working directory (not overwriting existing files).
trans-unit.target: 将把索引中列出的所有文件复制到工作目录中(不覆盖现有文件)。

trans-unit.source: Will fail unless you manually run git fetch origin-push. This method is of course entirely defeated by something that runs git fetch --all, in that case you’d need to either disable it or do something more tedious like:
trans-unit.target: 除非您手动运行 git fetch origin-push ,否则它将失败。当然，此方法完全被运行 git fetch --all 的东西所击败，在这种情况下，您需要禁用它或做一些更乏味的事情，例如：

trans-unit.source: Windows-only: allow redirecting the standard input/output/error handles to paths specified by the environment variables. This is particularly useful in multi-threaded applications where the canonical way to pass standard handles via CreateProcess() is not an option because it would require the handles to be marked inheritable (and consequently every spawned process would inherit them, possibly blocking regular Git operations). The primary intended use case is to use named pipes for communication (e.g. \\.\pipe\my-git-stdin-123).
trans-unit.target: 仅限Windows：允许将标准输入/输出/错误句柄重定向到环境变量指定的路径。这在多线程应用程序中特别有用，在该应用程序中，不能通过 CreateProcess() 传递标准句柄的规范方法是可选的，因为它将要求将句柄标记为可继承（因此，每个生成的进程都将继承它们，从而可能阻止常规的Git操作） ）。主要的预期用例是使用命名管道进行通信（例如 \\.\pipe\my-git-stdin-123 ）。

trans-unit.source: Windows-only: comma-separated list of environment variables' names that need to be unset before spawning any other process. Defaults to PERL5LIB to account for the fact that Git for Windows insists on using its own Perl interpreter.
trans-unit.target: 仅限Windows：用逗号分隔的环境变量名称列表，需要在产生任何其他进程之前取消设置。默认值是 PERL5LIB ,以说明Git for Windows坚持使用自己的Perl解释器的事实。

trans-unit.source: Windows-only: override whether spawned processes inherit only standard file handles (stdin, stdout and stderr) or all handles. Can be auto, true or false. Defaults to auto, which means true on Windows 7 and later, and false on older Windows versions.
trans-unit.target: 仅限Windows：覆盖生成的进程仅继承标准文件句柄（ stdin ， stdout 和 stderr ）还是继承所有句柄。可以是 auto ， true 或 false 。默认为 auto ，这意味着在Windows 7及更高版本上为 true ，在较早的Windows版本上为 false 。

trans-unit.source: With --abbrev set to 0, the command can be used to find the closest tagname without any suffix:
trans-unit.target: 当 --abbrev 设置为 0 时,该命令可以用来寻找最接近的 tagname,不需要任何后缀。

trans-unit.source: With --all, the command can use branch heads as references, so the output shows the reference path as well:
trans-unit.target: 使用--all,命令可以使用分支头作为引用,所以输出也会显示引用路径。

trans-unit.source: With --batch or --batch-check, follow symlinks inside the repository when requesting objects with extended SHA-1 expressions of the form tree-ish:path-in-tree. Instead of providing output about the link itself, provide output about the linked-to object. If a symlink points outside the tree-ish (e.g. a link to /foo or a root-level link to ../foo), the portion of the link which is outside the tree will be printed.
trans-unit.target: 使用 --batch 或 --batch-check,当请求使用扩展的 SHA-1 表达式(形式为 tree-ish:path-in-tree)的对象时,可以在版本库中跟踪符号链接。不提供关于链接本身的输出,而是提供关于链接到的对象的输出。如果一个符号链接指向树状结构之外(例如指向/foo的链接或指向./foo的根级链接),那么树状结构之外的链接部分将被打印出来。

trans-unit.source: With --no-commit perform the merge and stop just before creating a merge commit, to give the user a chance to inspect and further tweak the merge result before committing.
trans-unit.target: 使用--no-commit执行合并,并在创建合并提交前停止,让用户在提交前有机会检查并进一步调整合并结果。

trans-unit.source: With --no-log do not list one-line descriptions from the actual commits being merged.
trans-unit.target: 使用--no-log时,不列出实际提交中的单行描述。

trans-unit.source: With --no-signoff do not add a Signed-off-by line.
trans-unit.target: 使用--no-signoff时,不添加Signed-off-by行。

trans-unit.source: With --no-squash perform the merge and commit the result. This option can be used to override --squash.
trans-unit.target: 使用 --no-squash 执行合并并提交结果。这个选项可以用来覆盖--squash。

trans-unit.source: With --squash, --commit is not allowed, and will fail.
trans-unit.target: 使用--squash,--commit是不允许的,而且会失败。

trans-unit.source: With -n or --no-stat do not show a diffstat at the end of the merge.
trans-unit.target: 使用-n或--no-stat在合并结束时不显示diffstat。

trans-unit.source: With --add, instead of changing existing URLs, new URL is added.
trans-unit.target: 使用 --add ，而不是更改现有URL，而是添加新URL。

trans-unit.source: With --add, instead of replacing the list of currently tracked branches, adds to that list.
trans-unit.target: 使用 --add ，而不是替换当前跟踪的分支列表，而是添加到该列表。

trans-unit.source: With --all flag, all refs that exist locally are transferred to the remote side. You cannot specify any <ref> if you use this flag.
trans-unit.target: 使用 --all 标志，本地存在的所有引用都将传输到远程端。如果使用此标志，则不能指定任何 <ref> 。

trans-unit.source: With --all, all URLs for the remote will be listed.
trans-unit.target: 使用 --all ，将列出远程的所有URL。

trans-unit.source: With --contains, shows only the branches that contain the named commit (in other words, the branches whose tip commits are descendants of the named commit), --no-contains inverts it. With --merged, only branches merged into the named commit (i.e. the branches whose tip commits are reachable from the named commit) will be listed. With --no-merged only branches not merged into the named commit will be listed. If the <commit> argument is missing it defaults to HEAD (i.e. the tip of the current branch).
trans-unit.target: 使用 --contains ，仅显示包含命名提交的分支（换句话说，其尖端提交是命名提交的后代的分支），-- --no-contains 反转。使用 --merged ，将仅列出合并到命名提交中的分支（即，可以从命名提交到达其尖端提交的分支）。使用 --no-merged ,将仅列出未合并到命名提交中的分支。如果缺少<commit>参数，则默认为 HEAD （即当前分支的尖端）。

trans-unit.source: With --create-reflog, update-ref will create a reflog for each ref even if one would not ordinarily be created.
trans-unit.target: 使用 --create-reflog ，即使通常不会创建一个引用，update-ref也会为每个引用创建一个引用日志。

trans-unit.source: With --delete, instead of changing existing URLs, all URLs matching regex <url> are deleted for remote <name>. Trying to delete all non-push URLs is an error.
trans-unit.target: 使用 --delete ，而不是更改现有URL，将删除所有与正则表达式<url>匹配的URL，以用于远程<name>。尝试删除所有非推送URL是一个错误。

trans-unit.source: With --dry-run option, report what branches will be pruned, but do not actually prune them.
trans-unit.target: 使用 --dry-run 选项，报告将修剪哪些分支，但实际上不修剪它们。

trans-unit.source: With --dry-run option, report what branches would be pruned, but do not actually prune them.
With --ff-only, resolve the merge as a fast-forward when possible. When not possible, refuse to merge and exit with a non-zero status.
trans-unit.target: 使用 --ff-only ，在可能的情况下将合并解析为快进。如果不可能，请拒绝合并并以非零状态退出。

trans-unit.source: With --ff, when possible resolve the merge as a fast-forward (only update the branch pointer to match the merged branch; do not create a merge commit). When not possible (when the merged-in history is not a descendant of the current history), create a merge commit.
trans-unit.target: 使用 --ff ，尽可能将合并解析为快进（仅更新分支指针以匹配合并的分支；不创建合并提交）。如果不可能（当合并的历史记录不是当前历史记录的后代时），请创建合并提交。

trans-unit.source: With --force, the fast-forward check is disabled for all refs.
trans-unit.target: 使用 --force ，将禁用所有引用的快进检查。

trans-unit.source: With --keep-cr, call git mailsplit (see git-mailsplit[1]) with the same option, to prevent it from stripping CR at the end of lines. am.keepcr configuration variable can be used to specify the default behaviour. --no-keep-cr is useful to override am.keepcr.
trans-unit.target: 使用 --keep-cr ，使用相同的选项调用 git mailsplit （请参阅git-mailsplit [1]），以防止它在行尾剥离CR。 am.keepcr 配置变量可用于指定默认行为。 --no-keep-cr 对于覆盖 am.keepcr 很有用。

trans-unit.source: With --no-ff, create a merge commit in all cases, even when the merge could instead be resolved as a fast-forward.
trans-unit.target: 使用 --no-ff ，即使在合并可以替代为快进的情况下，也可以在所有情况下创建合并提交。

trans-unit.source: With --no-tags option, git fetch <name> does not import tags from the remote repository.
trans-unit.target: 使用 --no-tags 选项， git fetch <name> 不会从远程存储库导入标签。

trans-unit.source: With --patch, you can interactively select hunks from the diff between HEAD and the working tree to be stashed. The stash entry is constructed such that its index state is the same as the index state of your repository, and its worktree contains only the changes you selected interactively. The selected changes are then rolled back from your worktree. See the “Interactive Mode” section of git-add[1] to learn how to operate the --patch mode.
trans-unit.target: 使用 --patch ，您可以从HEAD与要隐藏的工作树之间的差异中交互选择块。存储项的构造应使其索引状态与存储库的索引状态相同，并且其工作树仅包含交互式选择的更改。然后，所选更改将从工作树中回滚。请参阅git-add [1]的“交互模式”部分，以了解如何操作 --patch 模式。

trans-unit.source: With --pretty format other than oneline and reference (for obvious reasons), this causes the output to have two extra lines of information taken from the reflog. The reflog designator in the output may be shown as ref@{Nth} (where Nth is the reverse-chronological index in the reflog) or as ref@{timestamp} (with the timestamp for that entry), depending on a few rules:
trans-unit.target: 使用 --pretty 格式而不是 oneline 和 reference （出于明显的原因），这会导致输出从reflog中获取两行额外的信息。根据一些规则，输出中的reflog指示符可能显示为 ref@{Nth} （其中 Nth 是reflog中的倒序索引）或 ref@{timestamp} （具有该条目的时间戳）。

trans-unit.source: With --prune option, run pruning against all the remotes that are updated.
trans-unit.target: 使用 --prune 选项，对所有已更新的远程运行修剪。

trans-unit.source: With --push, push URLs are manipulated instead of fetch URLs.
trans-unit.target: 使用 --push ，将操纵推入URL而不是获取URL。

trans-unit.source: With --push, push URLs are queried rather than fetch URLs.
trans-unit.target: 使用 --push ，查询的是推送URL，而不是获取URL。

trans-unit.source: With --stdin, update-ref reads instructions from standard input and performs all modifications together. Specify commands of the form:
trans-unit.target: 使用 --stdin ，update-ref从标准输入读取指令，并一起执行所有修改。指定格式的命令：

trans-unit.source: With --tags option, git fetch <name> imports every tag from the remote repository.
trans-unit.target: 使用 --tags 选项， git fetch <name> 从远程存储库导入每个标签。

trans-unit.source: With --topo-order, they would show 8 6 5 3 7 4 2 1 (or 8 7 4 2 6 5 3 1); some older commits are shown before newer ones in order to avoid showing the commits from two parallel development track mixed together.
trans-unit.target: 使用 --topo-order ，它们将显示8 6 5 3 7 4 2 1（或8 7 4 2 6 5 3 1）；为了避免显示来自两个并行开发轨道的提交混合在一起，在较新的提交之前显示一些较旧的提交。

trans-unit.source: With -a or --auto, the remote is queried to determine its HEAD, then the symbolic-ref refs/remotes/<name>/HEAD is set to the same branch. e.g., if the remote HEAD is pointed at next, "git remote set-head origin -a" will set the symbolic-ref refs/remotes/origin/HEAD to refs/remotes/origin/next. This will only work if refs/remotes/origin/next already exists; if not it must be fetched first.
trans-unit.target: 使用 -a 或 --auto ，查询远程以确定其 HEAD ，然后将符号引用 refs/remotes/<name>/HEAD 设置到同一分支。例如，如果远程 HEAD 指向 next ，则“ git remote set-head origin -a ”会将symbolic-ref refs/remotes/origin/HEAD 设置为 refs/remotes/origin/next 。仅当 refs/remotes/origin/next 已经存在时，这才起作用。如果不是，则必须先获取它。

trans-unit.source: With -a or --auto, the remote is queried to determine its HEAD, then the symbolic-ref refs/remotes/<name>/HEAD is set to the same branch. e.g., if the remote HEAD is pointed at next, git remote set-head origin -a will set the symbolic-ref refs/remotes/origin/HEAD to refs/remotes/origin/next. This will only work if refs/remotes/origin/next already exists; if not it must be fetched first.
With -d flag, it deletes the named <ref> after verifying it still contains <oldvalue>.
trans-unit.target: 使用 -d 标志，它在验证命名的<ref>仍然包含<oldvalue>后将其删除。

trans-unit.source: With -d or --delete, the symbolic ref refs/remotes/<name>/HEAD is deleted.
trans-unit.target: 使用 -d 或 --delete ，将删除符号ref refs/remotes/<name>/HEAD 。

trans-unit.source: With -f option, git fetch <name> is run immediately after the remote information is set up.
trans-unit.target: 使用 -f 选项，在设置远程信息后立即运行 git fetch <name> 。

trans-unit.source: With -m <master> option, a symbolic-ref refs/remotes/<name>/HEAD is set up to point at remote’s <master> branch. See also the set-head command.
trans-unit.target: 使用 -m <master> 选项，可以将符号引用 refs/remotes/<name>/HEAD 设置为指向remote的 <master> 分支。另请参见set-head命令。

trans-unit.source: With -n option, the remote heads are not queried first with git ls-remote <name>; cached information is used instead.
trans-unit.target: 使用 -n 选项，不首先使用 git ls-remote <name> 查询远程头；而是使用缓存的信息。

trans-unit.source: With -t <branch> option, instead of the default glob refspec for the remote to track all branches under the refs/remotes/<name>/ namespace, a refspec to track only <branch> is created. You can give more than one -t <branch> to track multiple branches without grabbing all branches.
trans-unit.target: 使用 -t <branch> 选项，代替用于跟踪 refs/remotes/<name>/ 名称空间下所有分支的远程默认glob refspec，将创建仅跟踪 <branch> 的refspec 。您可以指定多个 -t <branch> 来跟踪多个分支，而不用抓住所有分支。

trans-unit.source: With add, a new trailer will be added, even if some trailers with the same (<token>, <value>) pair are already in the message.
trans-unit.target: 使用 add ，即使消息中已经有一些具有相同（<token>，<value>）对的预告片，也会添加新的预告片。

trans-unit.source: With add, a new trailer will be added.
trans-unit.target: 使用 add ，将添加一个新的预告片。

trans-unit.source: With add, create a new branch named <new-branch> starting at <commit-ish>, and check out <new-branch> into the new working tree. If <commit-ish> is omitted, it defaults to HEAD. By default, -b refuses to create a new branch if it already exists. -B overrides this safeguard, resetting <new-branch> to <commit-ish>.

With add, create a new branch named <new-branch> starting at <commit-ish>, and check out <new-branch> into the new working tree. If <commit-ish> is omitted, it defaults to HEAD. By default, -b refuses to create a new branch if it already exists. -B overrides this safeguard, resetting <new-branch> to <commit-ish>.
trans-unit.target: 随着 add ，创建一个名为新分支 <new-branch> 开始 <commit-ish> ，并检查了 <new-branch> 进入新的工作树。如果省略 <commit-ish> ，则默认为HEAD。缺省情况下， -b 拒绝创建新分支（如果已存在）。 -B 覆盖此保护措施，将 <new-branch> 重置为 <commit-ish> 。

trans-unit.source: With add, detach HEAD in the new working tree. See "DETACHED HEAD" in git-checkout[1].
With add, detach HEAD in the new working tree. See "DETACHED HEAD" in git-checkout[1].
trans-unit.target: 使用 add ，将HEAD分离到新的工作树中。参见git-checkout [1]中的 “ DETACHED HEAD” 。

trans-unit.source: With add, suppress feedback messages.
trans-unit.target: 使用 add ，抑制反馈消息。

trans-unit.source: With addIfDifferent, a new trailer will be added only if no trailer with the same (<token>, <value>) pair is already in the message.
trans-unit.target: 使用 addIfDifferent ，仅当消息中不存在具有相同（<token>，<value>）对的预告片时，才会添加新的预告片。

trans-unit.source: With addIfDifferentNeighbor, a new trailer will be added only if no trailer with the same (<token>, <value>) pair is above or below the line where the new trailer will be added.
trans-unit.target: 使用 addIfDifferentNeighbor 时，仅当没有新的预告片具有相同（<token>，<value>）对时，才会添加新的预告片。

trans-unit.source: With doNothing, nothing will be done.
trans-unit.target: 使用 doNothing ，将不会执行任何操作。

trans-unit.source: With doNothing, nothing will be done; that is no new trailer will be added if there is already one with the same <token> in the message.
trans-unit.target: 使用 doNothing ，什么也做不了；如果消息中已经存在具有相同<token>的预告片，则不会添加新预告片。

trans-unit.source: With git format-patch --base=P -3 C (or variants thereof, e.g. with --cover-letter or using Z..C instead of -3 C to specify the range), the base tree information block is shown at the end of the first message the command outputs (either the first patch, or the cover letter), like this:
trans-unit.target: 使用 git format-patch --base=P -3 C （或其变体，例如，使用 --cover-letter 或使用 Z..C 代替 -3 C 来指定范围）时，基本树信息块显示为命令输出的第一条消息的末尾（第一个补丁或求职信），如下所示：

trans-unit.source: With list, output in an easy-to-parse format for scripts. This format will remain stable across Git versions and regardless of user configuration. See below for details.
trans-unit.target: 使用 list ，以易于解析的格式输出脚本。无论用户配置如何，此格式在Git版本之间都将保持稳定。有关详情，请参见下文。

trans-unit.source: With lock, an explanation why the working tree is locked.
trans-unit.target: 使用 lock ，说明工作树被锁定的原因。

trans-unit.source: With prune, do not remove anything; just report what it would remove.
trans-unit.target: 使用 prune 时，请勿移除任何东西；只需报告将删除的内容即可。

trans-unit.source: With prune, only expire unused working trees older than <time>.
trans-unit.target: 使用 prune 时，只会使早于<time>的未使用的工作树过期。

trans-unit.source: With prune, only expire unused working trees older than <time>.
With prune, report all removals.
trans-unit.target: 使用 prune ，报告所有删除。

trans-unit.source: With replace, an existing trailer with the same <token> will be deleted and the new trailer will be added. The deleted trailer will be the closest one (with the same <token>) to the place where the new one will be added.
trans-unit.target: 使用 replace ，将删除具有相同<token>的现有预告片，并添加新的预告片。删除的预告片将是最接近的预告片（具有相同的<token>），该位置将添加新的预告片。

trans-unit.source: With worktree add <path>, without <commit-ish>, instead of creating a new branch from HEAD, if there exists a tracking branch in exactly one remote matching the basename of <path>, base the new branch on the remote-tracking branch, and mark the remote-tracking branch as "upstream" from the new branch.

With worktree add <path>, without <commit-ish>, instead of creating a new branch from HEAD, if there exists a tracking branch in exactly one remote matching the basename of <path>, base the new branch on the remote-tracking branch, and mark the remote-tracking branch as "upstream" from the new branch.
trans-unit.target: 使用工作 worktree add <path> ，而不使用 <commit-ish> ，而不是从HEAD创建新分支，如果在与 <path> 的基本名称完全匹配的一个远程中存在跟踪分支，则将新分支基于远程跟踪分支，并将远程跟踪分支标记为新分支的“上游”。

trans-unit.source: With Git bisect it’s a breeze: in the best case i can get a ~15 step kernel bisection done in 20-30 minutes, in an automated way. Even with manual help or when bisecting multiple, overlapping bugs, it’s rarely more than an hour.
trans-unit.target: 使用Git bisect轻而易举：在最佳情况下，我可以在20-30分钟内以自动化方式完成〜15步的内核二分法。即使有了手动帮助，或者将多个重叠的错误一分为二，也很少超过一个小时。

trans-unit.source: With a -d or -D option, <branchname> will be deleted. You may specify more than one branch for deletion. If the branch currently has a reflog then the reflog will also be deleted.
trans-unit.target: 使用 -d 或 -D 选项，将删除 <branchname> 。您可以指定多个分支进行删除。如果分支当前有一个参考日志，则该参考日志也将被删除。

trans-unit.source: With a -m or -M option, <oldbranch> will be renamed to <newbranch>. If <oldbranch> had a corresponding reflog, it is renamed to match <newbranch>, and a reflog entry is created to remember the branch renaming. If <newbranch> exists, -M must be used to force the rename to happen.
trans-unit.target: 使用 -m 或 -M 选项，<oldbranch>将重命名为<newbranch>。如果<oldbranch>具有相应的引用日志，则将其重命名为与<newbranch>匹配，并创建一个引用日志条目以记住分支重命名。如果<newbranch>存在，则必须使用-M强制进行重命名。

trans-unit.source: With a small group, developers may just pull changes from each other’s repositories without the need for a central maintainer.
trans-unit.target: 在一个小组的情况下，开发人员可以从彼此的存储库中提取更改，而无需中央维护者。

trans-unit.source: With an optional <ref> argument, use the ref to find the notes to display. The ref can specify the full refname when it begins with refs/notes/; when it begins with notes/, refs/ and otherwise refs/notes/ is prefixed to form a full name of the ref.
trans-unit.target: 通过可选的 <ref> 参数，使用ref查找要显示的注释。当ref以 refs/notes/ 开头时，可以指定完整的refname ；当它与开始 notes/ ， refs/ 否则 refs/notes/ 前缀，以形成REF的全名。

trans-unit.source: With an optional argument, you can return to a different commit instead:
trans-unit.target: 通过一个可选参数,你可以返回到另一个提交。

trans-unit.source: With centralized revision control systems this is often accomplished by including every module in one single repository. Developers can check out all modules or only the modules they need to work with. They can even modify files across several modules in a single commit while moving things around or updating APIs and translations.
trans-unit.target: 在集中式的修订控制系统中,这通常是通过将每个模块包含在一个单一的版本库中来实现的。开发人员可以查看所有模块,也可以只查看他们需要的模块,他们甚至可以在一次提交中修改多个模块的文件,同时移动东西或更新API和翻译。他们甚至可以在一次提交中修改多个模块的文件,同时移动东西或更新API和翻译。

trans-unit.source: With no arguments, shows a list of existing remotes. Several subcommands are available to perform operations on the remotes.
trans-unit.target: 无参数时,显示现有遥控器的列表。有几个子命令可以对遥控器进行操作。

trans-unit.source: With no arguments, shows the status of existing submodules. Several subcommands are available to perform operations on the submodules.
trans-unit.target: 无参数时,显示现有子模块的状态。有几个子命令可以对子模块进行操作。

trans-unit.source: With no arguments, this will:
trans-unit.target: 在没有争论的情况下,这将。

trans-unit.source: With no options and no COMMAND or GUIDE given, the synopsis of the git command and a list of the most commonly used Git commands are printed on the standard output.
trans-unit.target: 如果没有选项，也没有提供COMMAND或GUIDE，则 git 命令的提要和最常用的Git命令的列表会打印在标准输出上。

trans-unit.source: With something like git.git current tree, I get:
trans-unit.target: 用git.git current tree这样的东西,我得到了。

trans-unit.source: With that configuration the full path to browse repositories would be:
trans-unit.target: 有了这个配置,浏览仓库的完整路径将是。

trans-unit.source: With the --append option, include all commits that are present in the existing commit-graph file.
trans-unit.target: 使用 --append 选项，包括现有提交图文件中存在的所有提交。

trans-unit.source: With the --branch option, the command takes a name and checks if it can be used as a valid branch name (e.g. when creating a new branch). But be cautious when using the previous checkout syntax that may refer to a detached HEAD state. The rule git check-ref-format --branch $name implements may be stricter than what git check-ref-format refs/heads/$name says (e.g. a dash may appear at the beginning of a ref component, but it is explicitly forbidden at the beginning of a branch name). When run with --branch option in a repository, the input is first expanded for the “previous checkout syntax” @{-n}. For example, @{-1} is a way to refer the last thing that was checked out using "git switch" or "git checkout" operation. This option should be used by porcelains to accept this syntax anywhere a branch name is expected, so they can act as if you typed the branch name. As an exception note that, the “previous checkout operation” might result in a commit object name when the N-th last thing checked out was not a branch.
trans-unit.target: 使用 --branch 选项，该命令将使用一个名称，并检查它是否可以用作有效的分支名称（例如，在创建新分支时）。但是，在使用以前的可能指向分离的HEAD状态的签出语法时，请务必谨慎。该规则 git check-ref-format --branch $name 工具可能会更严格比什么 git check-ref-format refs/heads/$name 说（如破折号，可能会出现在裁判组件的开始，但它是明确分支名称的开头禁止）。在存储库中使用 --branch 选项运行时，将首先针对“先前的检出语法” @{-n} 扩展输入。例如， @{-1} 是一种引用使用“ git switch”或“ git checkout”操作检出的最后一件东西的方法。瓷器应使用此选项在需要分支名称的任何地方接受此语法，以便它们可以像您键入分支名称一样起作用。作为例外，请注意，如果第N位不是签出分支，则“先前的签出操作”可能会导致提交对象名称。

trans-unit.source: With the --changed-paths option, compute and write information about the paths changed between a commit and its first parent. This operation can take a while on large repositories. It provides significant performance gains for getting history of a directory or a file with git log -- <path>. If this option is given, future commit-graph writes will automatically assume that this option was intended. Use --no-changed-paths to stop storing this data.

With the --max-new-filters=<n> option, generate at most n new Bloom filters (if --changed-paths is specified). If n is -1, no limit is enforced. Only commits present in the new layer count against this limit. To retroactively compute Bloom filters over earlier layers, it is advised to use --split=replace. Overrides the commitGraph.maxNewFilters configuration.
With the --reachable option, generate the new commit graph by walking commits starting at all refs. (Cannot be combined with --stdin-commits or --stdin-packs.)
trans-unit.target: 使用 --reachable 选项，通过在所有引用处开始的提交来生成新的提交图。（不能与 --stdin-commits 或 --stdin-packs 结合使用。）

trans-unit.source: With the --shallow option, only check the tip commit-graph file in a chain of split commit-graphs.
trans-unit.target: 使用 --shallow 选项，仅在分割的提交图链中检查提示提交图文件。

trans-unit.source: With the --split option, write the commit-graph as a chain of multiple commit-graph files stored in <dir>/info/commit-graphs. The new commits not already in the commit-graph are added in a new "tip" file. This file is merged with the existing file if the following merge conditions are met:
trans-unit.target: 使用 --split 选项，将提交图写入存储在 <dir>/info/commit-graphs 中的多个提交图文件链中。提交图中尚未包含的新提交将添加到新的“提示”文件中。如果满足以下合并条件，则此文件与现有文件合并：

trans-unit.source: With the --split[=<strategy>] option, write the commit-graph as a chain of multiple commit-graph files stored in <dir>/info/commit-graphs. Commit-graph layers are merged based on the strategy and other splitting options. The new commits not already in the commit-graph are added in a new "tip" file. This file is merged with the existing file if the following merge conditions are met:

With the --stdin-commits option, generate the new commit graph by walking commits starting at the commits specified in stdin as a list of OIDs in hex, one OID per line. (Cannot be combined with --stdin-packs or --reachable.)
trans-unit.target: 使用 --stdin-commits 选项，通过遍历从stdin中指定的提交（以十六进制的OID列表）开始的提交（每行一个OID）来生成新的提交图。（不能与 --reachable --stdin-packs 或--reachable结合使用。）

trans-unit.source: With the --stdin-commits option, generate the new commit graph by walking commits starting at the commits specified in stdin as a list of OIDs in hex, one OID per line. OIDs that resolve to non-commits (either directly, or by peeling tags) are silently ignored. OIDs that are malformed, or do not exist generate an error. (Cannot be combined with --stdin-packs or --reachable.)
With the --stdin-packs option, generate the new commit graph by walking objects only in the specified pack-indexes. (Cannot be combined with --stdin-commits or --reachable.)
trans-unit.target: 使用 --stdin-packs 选项，仅通过在指定的pack-indexs中遍历对象即可生成新的提交图。（不能与 --reachable --stdin-commits 或--reachable结合使用。）

trans-unit.source: With the subsystem reflog: after git fetch, the old tip of subsystem is at subsystem@{1}. Subsequent fetches will increase the number. (See git-reflog[1].)
trans-unit.target: 使用 subsystem reflog：在 git fetch 之后， subsystem 的旧提示位于 subsystem@{1} 。随后的提取将增加数量。（请参见git-reflog [1]。）

trans-unit.source: With the exception of raw file data (which Git does not interpret) the fast-import input format is text (ASCII) based. This text based format simplifies development and debugging of frontend programs, especially when a higher level language such as Perl, Python or Ruby is being used.
trans-unit.target: 除了原始文件数据(Git 不解释),快速导入的输入格式是基于文本(ASCII)的。这种基于文本的格式简化了前端程序的开发和调试,尤其是在使用Perl、Python或Ruby等高级语言时。

trans-unit.source: With the latter, you can use the manual viewer of your choice; see git-help[1] for more information.
trans-unit.target: 对于后者，您可以使用所选的手动查看器。有关更多信息，请参见git-help [1]。

trans-unit.source: With the right arguments, git diff can also show us the difference between the working directory and the last commit, or between the index and the last commit:
trans-unit.target: 使用正确的参数， git diff 也可以向我们显示工作目录和最后一次提交之间的差异，或者索引和最后一次提交之间的差异：

trans-unit.source: With the strategies that use 3-way merge (including the default, recursive), if a change is made on both branches, but later reverted on one of the branches, that change will be present in the merged result; some people find this behavior confusing. It occurs because only the heads and the merge base are considered when performing a merge, not the individual commits. The merge algorithm therefore considers the reverted change as no change at all, and substitutes the changed version instead.
trans-unit.target: 对于使用三向合并的策略（包括默认的 recursive ），如果在两个分支上都进行了更改，但随后又在其中一个分支上进行了还原，则该更改将出现在合并结果中；有些人觉得这种行为令人困惑。发生这种情况是因为执行合并时仅考虑头和合并基数，而不考虑单个提交。因此，合并算法将还原后的更改视为完全没有更改，并替代了更改后的版本。

trans-unit.source: With this option, git cherry-pick will let you edit the commit message prior to committing.
trans-unit.target: 使用此选项， git cherry-pick 将允许您在提交之前编辑提交消息。

trans-unit.source: With this option, git gc checks whether any housekeeping is required; if not, it exits without performing any work.
trans-unit.target: 使用此选项， git gc 检查是否需要任何内务处理；如果没有，它将退出而不进行任何工作。

trans-unit.source: With this option, git revert will let you edit the commit message prior to committing the revert. This is the default if you run the command from a terminal.
trans-unit.target: 使用此选项， git revert 将允许您在提交还原之前编辑提交消息。如果从终端运行命令，则这是默认设置。

trans-unit.source: With this option, git revert will not start the commit message editor.
trans-unit.target: 使用此选项， git revert 将不会启动提交消息编辑器。

trans-unit.source: With this option, merge-recursive spends a little extra time to avoid mismerges that sometimes occur due to unimportant matching lines (e.g., braces from distinct functions). Use this when the branches to be merged have diverged wildly. See also git-diff[1]--patience.
trans-unit.target: 使用此选项， merge-recursive 花费一些额外的时间来避免有时由于不重要的匹配行（例如，来自不同函数的花括号）而导致的合并错误。当要合并的分支发散很大时，请使用此选项。另请参见git-diff [1] --patience 。

trans-unit.source: With this option, diff output for a merge commit shows the differences from each of the parents to the merge result simultaneously instead of showing pairwise diff between a parent and the result one at a time. Furthermore, it lists only files which were modified from all parents.
trans-unit.target: 有了这个选项,合并提交的 diff 输出会同时显示每个父文件与合并结果的差异,而不是每次显示父文件与结果之间的成对差异。此外,它只列出所有父文件中被修改的文件。

trans-unit.source: With this option, git will replace all refnames, paths, blob contents, commit and tag messages, names, and email addresses in the output with anonymized data. Two instances of the same string will be replaced equivalently (e.g., two commits with the same author will have the same anonymized author in the output, but bear no resemblance to the original author string). The relationship between commits, branches, and tags is retained, as well as the commit timestamps (but the commit messages and refnames bear no resemblance to the originals). The relative makeup of the tree is retained (e.g., if you have a root tree with 10 files and 3 trees, so will the output), but their names and the contents of the files will be replaced.
trans-unit.target: 使用此选项,git 将用匿名数据替换输出中的所有 refnames、路径、blob 内容、提交和标签信息、姓名和电子邮件地址。同一字符串的两个实例将被等价替换(例如,两个作者相同的提交在输出中会有相同的匿名作者,但与原始作者字符串没有相似之处)。提交、分支和标签之间的关系以及提交时间戳都会被保留(但提交消息和 refnames 与原件没有相似之处)。树的相对构成会被保留(例如,如果你的根树有 10 个文件和 3 棵树,那么输出也会被保留),但它们的名字和文件的内容会被替换。

trans-unit.source: With this option, parents that are hidden by grafts are packed nevertheless.
trans-unit.target: 有了这个选项,被移植物隐藏的父母就会被包装不过。

trans-unit.source: With this option, the command includes the current branch to the list of revs to be shown when it is not given on the command line.
trans-unit.target: 有了这个选项,当命令行上没有给出时,命令会将当前分支加入到要显示的 revs 列表中。

trans-unit.source: With this, git show-branch without extra parameters would show only the primary branches. In addition, if you happen to be on your topic branch, it is shown as well.
trans-unit.target: 这样，没有额外参数的 git show-branch 将仅显示主要分支。此外，如果您恰好位于主题分支上，则也会显示该主题。

trans-unit.source: With this, Alice can perform the first part of the "pull" operation alone using the git fetch command without merging them with her own branch, using:
trans-unit.target: 这样，Alice可以使用 git fetch 命令单独执行“拉”操作的第一部分，而无需使用以下命令将它们与自己的分支合并：

trans-unit.source: Within a linked working tree, $GIT_DIR is set to point to this private directory (e.g. /path/main/.git/worktrees/test-next in the example) and $GIT_COMMON_DIR is set to point back to the main working tree’s $GIT_DIR (e.g. /path/main/.git). These settings are made in a .git file located at the top directory of the linked working tree.
trans-unit.target: 在链接的工作树中，将$ GIT_DIR设置为指向此私有目录（例如， /path/main/.git/worktrees/test-next 中的/path/main/.git/worktrees/test-next），而将$ GIT_COMMON_DIR设置为指向主工作树的$ GIT_DIR （例如 /path/main/.git ）。这些设置在链接工作树顶部目录中的 .git 文件中进行。

trans-unit.source: Within a linked working tree, $GIT_DIR is set to point to this private directory (e.g. /path/main/.git/worktrees/test-next in the example) and $GIT_COMMON_DIR is set to point back to the main working tree’s $GIT_DIR (e.g. /path/main/.git). These settings are made in a .git file located at the top directory of the linked working tree.
Without --all and without any <ref>, the heads that exist both on the local side and on the remote side are updated.
trans-unit.target: 如果没有 --all 并且没有任何 <ref> ，则更新在本地和远程存在的磁头。

trans-unit.source: Without --follow-symlinks, these would print data about the symlink itself. In the case of HEAD:link, you would see
trans-unit.target: 没有 --follow-symlinks ，它们将打印有关符号链接本身的数据。对于 HEAD:link ，您将看到

trans-unit.source: Without --force, the <src> ref is stored at the remote only if <dst> does not exist, or <dst> is a proper subset (i.e. an ancestor) of <src>. This check, known as "fast-forward check", is performed in order to avoid accidentally overwriting the remote ref and lose other peoples' commits from there.
trans-unit.target: 如果没有 --force ，则仅当<dst>不存在或<dst>是<src>的适当子集（即祖先）时，<src> ref才会存储在远程目录中。为了避免意外覆盖远程引用并从那里丢失其他人的提交，执行了称为“快速检查”的检查。

trans-unit.source: Without additional configuration, pushes the current branch to the configured upstream (remote.origin.merge configuration variable) if it has the same name as the current branch, and errors out without pushing otherwise.
trans-unit.target: 如果没有其他配置，则将当前分支推送到已配置的上游（ remote.origin.merge 配置变量）（如果它与当前分支具有相同的名称），并且在不进行推送的情况下出错。

trans-unit.source: Without an optional path parameter, all files and subdirectories of the current working directory are included in the archive. If one or more paths are specified, only these are included.
trans-unit.target: 如果没有可选的路径参数,当前工作目录的所有文件和子目录都会被包含在归档中。如果指定了一个或多个路径,则只包含这些路径。

trans-unit.source: Without any credential helpers defined, Git will try the following strategies to ask the user for usernames and passwords:
trans-unit.target: 在没有定义任何凭证助手的情况下,Git会尝试以下策略来要求用户输入用户名和密码。

trans-unit.source: Without disambiguating --, Git makes a reasonable guess, but errors out and asking you to disambiguate when ambiguous. E.g. if you have a file called HEAD in your work tree, git diff HEAD is ambiguous, and you have to say either git diff HEAD -- or git diff -- HEAD to disambiguate.
trans-unit.target: 没有歧义 -- ，Git会做出合理的猜测，但会出错并要求您在歧义时消除歧义。例如，如果您的工作树中有一个名为HEAD的文件，则 git diff HEAD 模棱两可，您必须说 git diff HEAD -- 或 git diff -- HEAD 才能消除歧义。

trans-unit.source: Without the -z option, pathnames with "unusual" characters are quoted as explained for the configuration variable core.quotePath (see git-config[1]).
trans-unit.target: 如果不使用 -z 选项，则引用带有“不寻常”字符的路径名，如配置变量 core.quotePath 所述（参见git-config [1]）。

trans-unit.source: Without the -z option, pathnames with "unusual" characters are quoted as explained for the configuration variable core.quotePath (see git-config[1]). Using -z the filename is output verbatim and the line is terminated by a NUL byte.
trans-unit.target: 如果不使用 -z 选项，则引用带有“不寻常”字符的路径名，如配置变量 core.quotePath 所述（参见git-config [1]）。使用 -z ，文件名将按原样输出，并且该行以NUL字节终止。

trans-unit.source: Without the --more=1 option, git show-branch would not output the [master^] commit, as [mybranch] commit is a common ancestor of both master and mybranch tips. Please see git-show-branch[1] for details.
trans-unit.target: 没有--more = 1选项，git show-branch将不会输出[master ^]提交，因为[mybranch]提交是master和mybranch技巧的共同祖先。有关详细信息，请参见git-show-branch [1]。

trans-unit.source: Without this flag, git log -p <path>... shows commits that touch the specified paths, and diffs about the same specified paths. With this, the full diff is shown for commits that touch the specified paths; this means that "<path>…​" limits only commits, and doesn’t limit diff for those commits.
trans-unit.target: 如果没有此标志，则 git log -p <path>... 显示接触指定路径的提交，以及与相同指定路径有关的差异。这样，对于接触指定路径的提交，将显示完整差异。这意味着“ <path>…...”仅限制提交，而不限制这些提交的差异。

trans-unit.source: Without this option, pathnames with "unusual" characters are quoted as explained for the configuration variable core.quotePath (see git-config[1]).
trans-unit.target: 如果没有此选项，则引用带有“不寻常”字符的路径名，如配置变量 core.quotePath 所述（参见git-config [1]）。

trans-unit.source: Workflow for a third party library
trans-unit.target: 第三方图书馆的工作流程

trans-unit.source: Workflow for an artificially split repo
trans-unit.target: 人工分割回购的工作流程

trans-unit.source: Workflows
trans-unit.target: Workflows

trans-unit.source: Working branch; defaults to HEAD.
trans-unit.target: 工作分支;默认为 HEAD。

trans-unit.source: Working directory specific configuration file for the main working directory in multiple working directory setup (see git-worktree[1]).
trans-unit.target: 多个工作目录设置中主要工作目录的工作目录特定配置文件（请参阅git-worktree [1]）。

trans-unit.source: Working directory specific configuration file.
trans-unit.target: 工作目录专用配置文件。

trans-unit.source: Working trees can be identified by path, either relative or absolute.
trans-unit.target: 工作树可以通过路径来识别,可以是相对的,也可以是绝对的。

trans-unit.source: Working with others
trans-unit.target: 与他人合作

trans-unit.source: Working with others, shared repository style
trans-unit.target: 与他人合作,共享存储库风格

trans-unit.source: Works just like --signature except the signature is read from a file.
trans-unit.target: 除了从文件中读取签名外,工作原理和--signature一样。

trans-unit.source: Works just like format.signature except the contents of the file specified by this variable will be used as the signature.
trans-unit.target: 和format.signature一样,除了这个变量指定的文件内容将被用作签名。

trans-unit.source: Works like git push <remote>, where <remote> is the current branch’s remote (or origin, if no remote is configured for the current branch).
trans-unit.target: 像 git push <remote> 一样工作，其中<remote>是当前分支的远程对象（如果没有为当前分支配置任何远程对象，则是 origin ）。

trans-unit.source: Wrap code spawning child processes.
trans-unit.target: 包裹代码产生子进程。

trans-unit.source: Write a MIDX file for the packfiles in an alternate object store.
trans-unit.target: 在另一个对象存储中为packfiles写一个MIDX文件。

trans-unit.source: Write a MIDX file for the packfiles in the current .git folder.
trans-unit.target: 为当前.git文件夹中的packfiles写一个MIDX文件。

trans-unit.source: Write a chapter on using plumbing and writing scripts.
trans-unit.target: 写一章使用水管和写脚本。

trans-unit.source: Write a commit-graph after fetching. This overrides the config setting fetch.writeCommitGraph.
trans-unit.target: 提取后写一个提交图。这将覆盖配置设置 fetch.writeCommitGraph 。

trans-unit.source: Write a commit-graph file based on the commits found in packfiles.
trans-unit.target: 根据packfiles中的提交内容,编写一个提交图文件。

trans-unit.source: Write a commit-graph file containing all commits in the current commit-graph file along with those reachable from HEAD.
trans-unit.target: 编写一个提交图文件，其中包含当前提交图文件中的所有提交以及可从 HEAD 访问的提交。

trans-unit.source: Write a commit-graph file containing all reachable commits.
trans-unit.target: 写一个包含所有可到达的提交的提交图文件。

trans-unit.source: Write a commit-graph file for the packed commits in your local .git directory.
trans-unit.target: 在本地 .git 目录中为打包的提交编写一个提交图文件。

trans-unit.source: Write a commit-graph file, extending the current commit-graph file using commits in <pack-index>.
trans-unit.target: 编写一个提交图文件，使用 <pack-index> 中的提交扩展当前提交图文件。

trans-unit.source: Write a new MIDX file.
trans-unit.target: 编写一个新的MIDX文件。

trans-unit.source: Write a reachability bitmap index as part of the repack. This only makes sense when used with -a or -A, as the bitmaps must be able to refer to all reachable objects. This option overrides the setting of repack.writeBitmaps. This option has no effect if multiple packfiles are created.
trans-unit.target: 写一个可达性位图索引作为重新打包的一部分。这仅在与 -a 或 -A 一起使用时才有意义，因为位图必须能够引用所有可访问的对象。此选项将覆盖 repack.writeBitmaps 的设置。如果创建了多个packfile，则此选项无效。

trans-unit.source: Write a set of patterns to the sparse-checkout file, as given as a list of arguments following the set subcommand. Update the working directory to match the new patterns. Enable the core.sparseCheckout config setting if it is not already enabled.
trans-unit.target: 将一组模式写入稀疏检出文件，如 set 子命令后面的参数列表所示。更新工作目录以匹配新模式。启用core.sparseCheckout配置设置（如果尚未启用）。

trans-unit.source: Write and verify Git commit-graph files
trans-unit.target: 编写和验证Git提交图文件

trans-unit.source: Write and verify multi-pack-indexes
trans-unit.target: 编写和验证多包索引

trans-unit.source: Write dangling objects into .git/lost-found/commit/ or .git/lost-found/other/, depending on type. If the object is a blob, the contents are written into the file, rather than its object name.
trans-unit.target: 将悬空对象写入 .git/lost-found/commit/或 .git/lost-found/other/,取决于类型。如果对象是 blob,内容会被写入文件,而不是对象名。

trans-unit.source: Write into pairs of files (.pack and .idx), using <base-name> to determine the name of the created file. When this option is used, the two files in a pair are written in <base-name>-<SHA-1>.{pack,idx} files. <SHA-1> is a hash based on the pack content and is written to the standard output of the command.
trans-unit.target: 使用<base-name>写入文件对（.pack和.idx），以确定所创建文件的名称。使用此选项时，成对的两个文件将写入<base-name>-<SHA-1>。{pack，idx}文件中。<SHA-1>是基于包内容的哈希，并被写入命令的标准输出。

trans-unit.source: Write or verify a multi-pack-index (MIDX) file.
trans-unit.target: 编写或验证一个多包索引(MIDX)文件。

trans-unit.source: Write responses to get-mark, cat-blob, and ls queries to the file descriptor <fd> instead of stdout. Allows progress output intended for the end-user to be separated from other output.
trans-unit.target: 将对 get-mark ， cat-blob 和 ls 查询的响应写到文件描述符<fd>而不是 stdout 。允许将最终用户的 progress 输出与其他输出分开。

trans-unit.source: Write the archive to <file> instead of stdout.
trans-unit.target: 将存档写到<file>而不是stdout。

trans-unit.source: Write the generated pack index into the specified file. Without this option the name of pack index file is constructed from the name of packed archive file by replacing .pack with .idx (and the program fails if the name of packed archive does not end with .pack).
trans-unit.target: 将生成的打包索引写入指定的文件中。如果没有这个选项,打包索引文件的名称是通过将.pack替换为.idx从打包存档文件的名称中构建出来的(如果打包存档的名称不以.pack结尾,程序就会失败)。

trans-unit.source: Write the list of remote refs fetched in the FETCH_HEAD file directly under $GIT_DIR. This is the default. Passing --no-write-fetch-head from the command line tells Git not to write the file. Under --dry-run option, the file is never written.
Write the pack contents (what would have been written to .pack file) out to the standard output.
trans-unit.target: 将包的内容(本来要写到.包文件的内容)写到标准输出。

trans-unit.source: Write the resulting index out in the named on-disk format version. Supported versions are 2, 3 and 4. The current default version is 2 or 3, depending on whether extra features are used, such as git add -N.
trans-unit.target: 用指定的磁盘格式版本写出结果索引。支持的版本为2、3和4。当前的默认版本为2或3，具体取决于是否使用了其他功能，例如 git add -N 。

trans-unit.source: Write to standard error. Note that if --detach is specified, the process disconnects from the real standard error, making this destination effectively equivalent to none.
trans-unit.target: 写入标准错误。请注意，如果指定了 --detach ，则该过程将与实际的标准错误断开连接，从而使该目标实际上等效于 none 。

trans-unit.source: Write to syslog, using the git-daemon identifier.
trans-unit.target: 使用 git-daemon 标识符写入syslog 。

trans-unit.source: Write whatever message you want, and all the lines that start with # will be pruned out, and the rest will be used as the commit message for the change. If you decide you don’t want to commit anything after all at this point (you can continue to edit things and update the index), you can just leave an empty message. Otherwise git commit will commit the change for you.
trans-unit.target: 编写所需的任何消息，所有以 # 开头的行都将被删除，其余的将用作更改的提交消息。如果您决定此时根本不提交任何内容（您可以继续编辑内容并更新索引），则可以留下一条空消息。否则 git commit 将为您提交更改。

trans-unit.source: Writes a tree object that represents a subdirectory <prefix>. This can be used to write the tree object for a subproject that is in the named subdirectory.
trans-unit.target: 编写一个表示子目录 <prefix> 的树对象。这可用于为命名子目录中的子项目编写树对象。

trans-unit.source: Writes the commit-id into the filename under $GIT_DIR/refs/<filename> on the local end after the transfer is complete.
trans-unit.target: 传输完成后，将提交ID写入本地端$ GIT_DIR / refs / <filename>下的文件名中。

trans-unit.source: X: "unknown" change type (most probably a bug, please report it)
trans-unit.target: X:"未知 "的更改类型(很可能是个错误,请报告)。

trans-unit.source: You must therefore ensure that the most recent commit of the branch you want to dcommit to is the first parent of the merge. Chaos will ensue otherwise, especially if the first parent is an older commit on the same SVN branch.
trans-unit.target: 因此，您 must 确保要提交到的分支的最新提交是合并的 first 父级。否则将导致混乱，特别是如果第一个父节点是同一SVN分支上的较早提交。

trans-unit.source: You also could say c or clean above as long as the choice is unique.
trans-unit.target: 您也可以在上面说 c 或 clean ，只要选择是唯一的即可。

trans-unit.source: You also could say s or sta or status above as long as the choice is unique.
trans-unit.target: 只要选择是唯一的，您也可以在上面说 s 或 sta 或 status 。

trans-unit.source: You also need to ensure that each repository is "bare" (without a Git index file) for cvs commit to work. See gitcvs-migration[7].
trans-unit.target: 您还需要确保每个存储库都是“裸露的”（没有Git索引文件），以便 cvs commit 工作。参见gitcvs-migration [7]。

trans-unit.source: You also should not rewind branches in a submodule beyond commits that were ever recorded in any superproject.
trans-unit.target: 你也不应该将子模块中的分支倒带,超过任何超级项目中曾经记录的提交。

trans-unit.source: You are happily working on something, and find the changes in these files are in good order. You do not want to see them when you run git diff, because you plan to work on other files and changes with these files are distracting.
trans-unit.target: 您很高兴在做某事，并且发现这些文件中的更改井井有条。您不希望在运行 git diff 时看到它们，因为您计划使用其他文件，而这些文件的更改会分散您的注意力。

trans-unit.source: You are in the middle of a refactoring session and your boss comes in and demands that you fix something immediately. You might typically use git-stash[1] to store your changes away temporarily, however, your working tree is in such a state of disarray (with new, moved, and removed files, and other bits and pieces strewn around) that you don’t want to risk disturbing any of it. Instead, you create a temporary linked working tree to make the emergency fix, remove it when done, and then resume your earlier refactoring session.
trans-unit.target: 您正处于重构会话的中间，老板进来并要求您立即修复某些问题。通常，您可能会使用git-stash [1]暂时存储所做的更改，但是，您的工作树处于混乱状态（新文件，已移动和已删除的文件以及其他零碎的东西）不想冒任何干扰的风险。而是，您创建一个临时链接的工作树来进行紧急修复，完成后将其删除，然后恢复较早的重构会话。

trans-unit.source: You are now ready to commit. You can see what is about to be committed using git diff with the --cached option:
trans-unit.target: 您现在可以提交了。您可以使用带有--cached选项的 git diff 查看即将提交的内容：

trans-unit.source: You can adjust how pages generated by gitweb look using the variables described below. You can change the site name, add common headers and footers for all pages, and add a description of this gitweb installation on its main page (which is the projects list page), etc.
trans-unit.target: 你可以使用下面描述的变量调整gitweb生成的页面的外观。你可以更改站点名称,为所有页面添加通用的页眉和页脚,并在其主页面(也就是项目列表页)上添加对这个gitweb安装的描述等。

trans-unit.source: You can also ask git log to show patches:

trans-unit.source: You can at any time create a new branch by just picking an arbitrary point in the project history, and just writing the SHA-1 name of that object into a file under .git/refs/heads/. You can use any filename you want (and indeed, subdirectories), but the convention is that the "normal" branch is called master. That’s just a convention, though, and nothing enforces it.

trans-unit.source: You can choose whether you want to trust the index file entirely (using the --cached flag) or ask the diff logic to show any files that don’t match the stat state as being "tentatively changed". Both of these operations are very useful indeed.

trans-unit.source: You can configure gitweb to only list and allow viewing of the explicitly exported repositories, via $export_ok variable in gitweb config file; see gitweb.conf[5] manpage. If it evaluates to true, gitweb shows repositories only if this file named by $export_ok exists in its object database (if directory has the magic file named $export_ok).

trans-unit.source: You can explicitly provide a full path to the tool by setting the configuration variable difftool.<tool>.path. For example, you can configure the absolute path to kdiff3 by setting difftool.kdiff3.path. Otherwise, git difftool assumes the tool is available in PATH.

trans-unit.source: You can explicitly provide a full path to the tool by setting the configuration variable mergetool.<tool>.path. For example, you can configure the absolute path to kdiff3 by setting mergetool.kdiff3.path. Otherwise, git mergetool assumes the tool is available in PATH.
trans-unit.target: 您可以通过设置配置变量 mergetool.<tool>.path 来显式提供该工具的完整路径。例如，您可以通过设置 mergetool.kdiff3.path 来配置kdiff3的绝对路径。否则， git mergetool 假定该工具在PATH中可用。

trans-unit.source: You can explicitly provide a full path to your preferred man viewer by setting the configuration variable man.<tool>.path. For example, you can configure the absolute path to konqueror by setting man.konqueror.path. Otherwise, git help assumes the tool is available in PATH.

trans-unit.source: You can go back and modify the old commit. You should never do this if you have already made the history public; Git does not normally expect the "history" of a project to change, and cannot correctly perform repeated merges from a branch that has had its history changed.
trans-unit.target: 您可以返回并修改旧的提交。如果您已经公开了历史记录,千万不要这么做;Git 通常不会期望项目的 "历史记录 "会发生变化,也不能正确地从一个已经改变了历史记录的分支中重复合并。

trans-unit.source: You can grow a new branch from any commit. For example, switch to "HEAD~3" and create branch "fixup":

trans-unit.source: You can have a mixture of files show up as "has been updated" and "is still dirty in the working directory" together. You can always tell which file is in which state, since the "has been updated" ones show a valid sha1, and the "not in sync with the index" ones will always have the special all-zero sha1.
trans-unit.target: 你可以让混合的文件一起显示为 "已经更新 "和 "在工作目录中仍然是脏文件"。你总是可以判断出哪个文件处于哪种状态,因为 "已经更新 "的文件会显示一个有效的sha1,而 "与索引不同步 "的文件总是有一个特殊的全零的sha1。

trans-unit.source: You can include a config file from another by setting the special include.path (or includeIf.*.path) variable to the name of the file to be included. The variable takes a pathname as its value, and is subject to tilde expansion. These variables can be given multiple times.
trans-unit.target: 您可以通过将特殊的 include.path （或 includeIf.*.path ）变量设置为要包含的文件的名称来包含另一个配置文件。该变量采用路径名作为其值，并且受波浪号的影响。这些变量可以多次给出。

trans-unit.source: You can include a config file from another conditionally by setting a includeIf.<condition>.path variable to the name of the file to be included.
trans-unit.target: 通过将 includeIf.<condition>.path 变量设置为要包含的文件的名称，可以有条件地包含另一个配置文件。

trans-unit.source: You can override these rules either by command-line options or by environment variables. The --global, --system and --worktree options will limit the file used to the global, system-wide or per-worktree file respectively. The GIT_CONFIG environment variable has a similar effect, but you can specify any filename you want.
trans-unit.target: 您可以通过命令行选项或环境变量覆盖这些规则。该 --global ， --system 和 --worktree 选项将限制用于全局，全系统或分别为每worktree文件的文件。该 GIT_CONFIG 环境变量有类似的效果，但您可以指定任何你想要的文件名。

trans-unit.source: You can tell Git to split the Git internal information from the directory that it tracks, but we’ll ignore that for now: it’s not how normal projects work, and it’s really only meant for special uses. trans-unit.source: You can think of this as a set operation. Commits given on the command line form a set of commits that are reachable from any of them, and then commits reachable from any of the ones given with ^ in front are subtracted from that set. The remaining commits are what comes out in the command’s output. Various other options and paths parameters can be used to further limit the result.
trans-unit.target: 您可以将其视为固定操作。在命令行上给出的提交构成了一组可从它们中的任何一个到达的提交，然后从该集合中减去前面带 ^ 给出的任何一个可到达的提交。其余的提交就是命令输出中显示的内容。各种其他选项和路径参数可用于进一步限制结果。

trans-unit.source: You can think of this as a set operation. trans-unit.target: 您可能正在使用 objects/info/alternates 或 $GIT_ALTERNATE_OBJECT_DIRECTORIES 机制从其他对象存储库 borrow 对象。具有这种不完整对象存储库的存储库不适合发布为与哑传输一起使用，但是只要 objects/info/alternates 指向它从中借用的对象存储库就可以了。

trans-unit.source: You could do without using any branches at all, by keeping as many local repositories as you would like to have branches, and merging between them with git pull, just like you merge between branches. The advantage of this approach is that it lets you keep a set of files for each branch checked out and you may find it easier to switch back and forth if you juggle multiple lines of development simultaneously. Of course, you will pay the price of more disk usage to hold multiple working trees, but disk space is cheap these days.
trans-unit.target: 您可以完全不使用任何分支，只要保留想要拥有分支的本地存储库，然后使用git pull在它们之间合并就可以了，就像您在分支之间合并一样。这种方法的优点是，它使您可以为每个 branch 保留一组文件，并且如果同时处理多行开发，可能会发现来回切换更加容易。当然，您将付出更多磁盘使用量的代价来容纳多个工作树，但是如今磁盘空间很便宜。
